units.title: Initiate hPSC monolayer culture from MEFs
units.text:
1 Initiate monolayer culture using cells that have been maintained as colonies on irradiated mouse embryonic fibroblasts (MEFs; option A) or, alternatively, from a frozen stock of monolayer-derived cells (option B). Both options should result in a similar HFO differentiation efficiency.
(A) Initiation of monolayer culture from hPSCs grown as colonies on MEFs ● Timing 20 min
(i) Obtain a six-well plate of high-quality hPSCs grown on MEFs (~80% confluency) in standard hPSC culture medium containing 20% KnockOut Serum Replacement (Fig. 3a). Dissociation of one well of the six-well plate should be sufficient to inoculate one T25 flask.
units.rationale: This is a direct, actionable step for initiating hPSC culture under defined conditions required for subsequent organoid formation.

units.title: Dissociate hPSCs using Accutase
units.text:
(ii) Aspirate the medium and wash with 3 mL of PBS w/o. Add 500 μL of Accutase, and place the plate into a humidified incubator at 37 °C for 3 min.
CRITICAL STEP The volumes given in this and subsequent steps are for one well of a six-well plate.
CRITICAL STEP Prolonged incubation with Accutase might be harmful for the cells.
units.rationale: This step specifies precise reagent, volume, and timing for cell dissociation, critical for successful monolayer culture initiation.

units.title: Centrifuge and resuspend hPSCs in E8 + Y27632
units.text:
(iii) Add 3 mL of DMEM/F12, and disperse the colonies into single cells by pipetting until all cells are detached.
(iv) Transfer the cell suspension to a 15 mL conical tube, and centrifuge at 300g for 3 min at 4 °C.
(v) Remove the supernatant, and gently resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of E8 + 10 μM Y27632.
units.rationale: This sequence of centrifugation and resuspension in specific medium is a key procedural step to prepare viable hPSCs for plating.

units.title: Plate hPSCs on Geltrex-coated flask
units.text:
(vi) Take a prepared Geltrex-coated T25 flask, aspirate the medium and add 4 mL E8 + 10 μM Y27632.
(vii) Transfer the cell suspension from step (v) to the T25 flask, and place the flask into the incubator. Move the flask a few times back and forth and left to right at the point where it is placed in the incubator to ensure that the cells are equally distributed (Supplementary Video 1).
units.rationale: This step details the exact method of cell plating on a coated surface, essential for uniform monolayer growth.

units.title: Change medium daily in hPSC monolayer culture
units.text:
(viii) Change the medium after 2 d and then daily by aspirating the medium and adding 5 mL of fresh E8. When the cells are confluent, proceed to the next step.
CRITICAL STEP Prewarm the required amount of culture medium in a water bath (37 °C) for 10–20 min before use.
units.rationale: Daily medium change with prewarming is a critical maintenance step to sustain hPSC viability and pluripotency.

units.title: Passage hPSCs using Accutase
units.text:
2 Take the confluent T25 flask (Fig. 3b; confluency is typically reached 2–4 d after seeding), aspirate the medium and add 5 mL of PBS w/o. Aspirate the PBS w/o, add 1 mL of Accutase and place the plate into the incubator.
CRITICAL STEP Prolonged incubation with Accutase might be harmful for the cells.
units.rationale: This is a standardized, timed passaging procedure critical for maintaining healthy hPSC monolayers before differentiation.

units.title: Centrifuge and resuspend cells during passaging
units.text:
3 Add 5 mL of DMEM/F12 to the flask, and rinse the flask bottom with the medium to detach the cells. Transfer the resulting cell suspension to a 15 mL conical tube, and centrifuge the tube at 300g for 3 min at 4 °C.
4 Remove the supernatant, and gently resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of E8 + 10 μM Y27632.
units.rationale: This step ensures consistent cell recovery and preparation for reseeding, a core procedural requirement.

units.title: Seed 5,000 hPSCs per well in 96-U-well plate
units.text:
11 Prepare a stock cell suspension at a concentration of 5,000 cells per 100 µL medium by adding an appropriate amount of cells from Step 10 (based on the desired number of HFOs) to E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Gently resuspend the cells.
CRITICAL STEP Seeding an appropriate cell number is critical. For all tested cell lines, 5,000 cells per well resulted in the successful formation of HFOs.
12 Seed 100 µL of the stock cell suspension per well of a U-shaped ultra-low attachment 96-well plate. Seed 12 wells (one row) more than the number of desired HFOs (Table 1).
units.rationale: This step defines the exact cell number and volume per well, which is critical for consistent aggregate formation.

units.title: Centrifuge 96-well plate to form aggregates
units.text:
13 Centrifuge the plate at 300g and 4 °C for 3 min to bring the cells to the culture plate bottom, and place the plate into the incubator.
CRITICAL STEP Ensure that, after centrifugation, the hPSCs form a round cell pellet at the culture plate bottom as shown in Fig. 4a. Place the plate into the incubator very carefully, and do not move it for at least 24 h to ensure that one round aggregate will form per well overnight.
units.rationale: This centrifugation protocol is essential for forming single, uniform hPSC aggregates, a foundational step in HFO generation.

units.title: Embed hPSC aggregates in Matrigel on d-2
units.text:
14 Before you start, take out the required amount of Matrigel aliquots from the freezer and let them thaw on ice. When the Matrigel is thawed, insert the aliquots into the ice. Take out the sterile scissors (heated to at least 180 °C for at least 3 h), and let them cool down at room temperature.
CRITICAL STEP Ensure the Matrigel is not growth-factor-reduced (use cat. no. 354234) and has an appropriate protein concentration; HFO formation has been validated with a Matrigel concentration range of 9.7–10.7 mg/mL. Do not use Geltrex instead of Matrigel since this will result in a failed differentiation based on our experience6.
15 In the meantime, take a look at the 96-U-well plate under the microscope to check if the hPSC aggregates have properly formed. Mark the properly formed aggregates (these will be further embedded in Matrigel) and cross out the rest (not round or too small aggregates; see Fig. 4b for examples; these aggregates can be discarded later).
CRITICAL STEP Embedding only properly formed aggregates (round, homogeneous, ~550–650 µm in diameter) is important.
units.rationale: This step specifies the exact Matrigel type, preparation, and selection criteria for aggregates, which are critical for successful 3D organoid formation.
